name: BoatStash

brief.problem: Boat owners lose track of spare parts stored in 50+ compartments. LOB (Lost On Boat) is a known problem — cruisers coined an acronym for it.
brief.target_user: Liveaboard cruisers and bluewater sailors with boats 30ft+
brief.proposed_solution: Snap photos of bin contents, AI identifies and catalogs items. Search where is my spare impeller and get the answer instantly.
brief.value_prop: Find any part in seconds instead of tearing apart the boat
brief.initial_revenue_model: Freemium - free for 1 boat/50 items, $4.99/mo for unlimited

ai_leverage.reasoning: Core functionality is AI vision — identifying parts from photos, categorizing, and making them searchable. Strong AI moat.

competition.reasoning: No direct competitor for boat-specific parts inventory. Generic apps like Sortly exist but are not boat-specific. Very low competition.

bootstrappability.reasoning: Can launch with mobile app + cloud sync. Offline-first adds complexity but is technically feasible with existing frameworks.

revenue_clarity.reasoning: Freemium model is clear. Cruisers will pay $150-300/year for self-reliance tools. Lifetime license ($49-99) may work better than subscription.

passive_potential.reasoning: Once built, runs itself. AI handles cataloging, users self-serve. Minimal support needed.

team_fit.reasoning: Ben moving to La Paz (huge boat community), dad has a boat, friends sailing around the world. Perfect distribution network.

side_project_viability.reasoning: Can build MVP in spare time. Offline-first architecture is the main complexity but doable.

market_timing.reasoning: Boat market is steady. AI vision tech is mature enough now. No specific urgency but no headwinds either.

summary: BoatStash addresses the validated LOB (Lost On Boat) problem with a photo-first AI inventory system. Very low competition in boat-specific parts tracking, strong distribution through Bens sailing network, and liveaboard cruisers have proven willingness to pay $150-300/yr for self-reliance tools. Main technical challenge is offline-first architecture, but this is also the competitive moat.
